snippet.title: Crane collapses onto apartment block at Wolli Creek injuring three people
snippet.content: Two unit blocks have been evacuated after a crane collapsed onto one of them at Wolli Creek in Sydney's south on Sunday morning. Just after 9:30am emergency services were called to Brodie Spark Drive following reports a crane had fallen from one building and onto a second building. Police said paramedics treated three people at the scene for minor injuries. They said no-one was inside the crane when it collapsed. SafeWork New South Wales has been notified. No trains are running between Central and Turrella on the T2 Airport line due to the collapse. Trains will continue to operate via Sydenham and buses are being organised to operate between Sydenham and Central.
